text: Hi everyone, we're preparing a minisymposium proposal and I had some questions. (1) The talks have to be pre-recorded, or the minisymposium will be hosted live? (2) Are the presentations given in the minisymposium eligible for publication in the conference proceedings (such as normal 30min talks)? (3) How do you feel to host a short introductory talk of the theme of the symposium from an expert in the field, but that is not Julia specific?

elements.text: Hi everyone, we're preparing a minisymposium proposal and I had some questions. (1) The talks have to be pre-recorded, or the minisymposium will be hosted live? (2) Are the presentations given in the minisymposium eligible for publication in the conference proceedings (such as normal 30min talks)? (3) How do you feel to host a short introductory talk of the theme of the symposium from an expert in the field, but that is not Julia specific?

text:
3. Allowed and encouraged.
It's a conference in a conference.
You can do what ever you want.

I am not on the committee this year, so can't speak to the rest.
I imagine yes for 2.
No idea for 1.

And pretty sure yes to putting all their names as speakers on the submission.
Or all the ones you know so far.
Can always update it after
